statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ -7 \\ 24 \\ -10 \\ 15 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -36 \\ 18 \\ -57 \\ 24 \\ -36 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ 1 \\ -5 \\ 2 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -3 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ -1 \\ 5 \\ -2 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 16 \\ -7 \\ 24 \\ -10 \\ 15 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -36 \\ 18 \\ -57 \\ 24 \\ -36 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
